intro: Aiouea acarodomatifera, commonly known as the New Zealand whitebeam, is a small evergreen tree native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey-brown bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody, spherical fruits. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas with well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
